thread.title: PrepXtra Pick: Sevier County vs. Morristown West - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: PrepXtra Pick: Sevier County vs. Morristown West - PrepXtra Story

author: knoxnews.com
title: PrepXtra Pick: Sevier County vs. Morristown West - PrepXtra
text:
Morristown West (7-1, 4-0 Region 1-5A) at Sevier County (7-2, 5-0), 7 p.m., MyVLT: The Region 1-5A champion will be determined when these teams with contrasting styles meet on Thursday. Sevier County boasts a fast-paced spread offense, led by Vanderbilt quarterback commitment Deuce Wallace. The Smoky Bears average 37.3 points per game. Morristown West, led by star safety Calvin Smith, has a sturdy defense that has surrendered just 5.9 points per game. Expect to see the Trojans use the passing game to open opportunities for Chattanooga running back commitment DeAndre Delaney. Sevier County has turned in a handful of spotty defensive efforts this season, but has improved as it has become healthier. Defensive tackle Desmond Pancotto (knee) is expected to return for the Smoky Bears, whose run of five consecutive district championships ended in their regular-season finale in 2014. They’ve had a year to let that feeling simmer.
PrepXtra Pick: Sevier County 31, Morristown West 28
Last Week: 28-8 (77.8 percent); Overall: 239-70 (77.4)
Nick Carboni’s Pick
Morristown West over Sevier County
Last Week: 29-7 (80.1 percent); Overall: 232-77 (75.1)
